Newton Venture Program's mission is to level the playing field for people from typically overlooked backgrounds - ensuring that the next generation of venture investors represent the world we live in. Newton is a joint venture between London Business School and LocalGlobe VC.
The VC Fundamentals program covers key areas such as the VC ecosystem, deal-flow, valuations, chemistry and conviction, negotiations, legals, follow-up financing, scaling up, and the future of VC.

Name: Yunus Ibrahim
Title: Venture Capital | Impact Investments
Summary: Yunus advocates for mission-driven, underrepresented founders, particularly women, first-generation entrepreneurs, and people of colour. With over 3 years of experience in Venture Capital, ESG, Corporate Finance, and Macroeconomics research, Yunus has gained insights into various markets in Sub-Saharan Africa and worked with diverse founders to build the prosperous African continent we all desire. He received a bachelor's degree in Accounting from the University of Lagos; and was 1 of 60 African scholars selected to study Technology, Entrepreneurship, and Design at the Nigerian University of Technology and Management (NUTM) on a full-ride scholarship! He is a beneficiary of several scholarships, including the Lagos State Government Scholarship Award and the Federal Government of Nigeria Scholarship Award for high-achieving students in public universities. Yunus advocates for Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging in the workplace. He loves to chat about Venture Building, Research, Financial Literacy, and Fashion.
